data.title: Beautiful building
data.text: This is a beautiful building on the outside. We didn't go in. We visited it during the Denver free walking tour (which I also recommend doing). Lots of history and details went into the development of this building. Good to see. Good area as well. Food trucks for lunch park in front of the building.

data.title: Nice architecture
data.text: The city building in Denver is where the mayor does business. It is located on one edge of Civic Center Park across from the Capitol Building.

data.title: Come for the Xmas lights
data.text: Only time it is worth to come here is during Xmas to watch the elaborate lights shows they do at this site.

data.title: Day out in Denver
data.text:
During our time visiting friends on the outskirts of Denver. We took a day out of the schedule to look around the City of Denver and some of the amazing sights and buildings there.

We didn't get to go inside this building, but the area outside and around her is great to visit.

data.title: Watched the Christmas Parade on the bleachers looking at this city building!
data.text: The building is striking lite up in a colorful hues. Love city buildings, the architecture is amazing, they don't disappoint.

data.title: Why bother?
data.text: The only interesting thing for a tourist is sitting in on an interesting courtroom case.  The place is full of lawyers.

data.title: #1 Holiday lights display in the country
data.text: This is the #1 Holiday lights display on a public building in the country. It's also the backdrop for the Holiday Parade of Lights. HINT, park somewhere down in LoDo and take the FREE 16th Street mall ride up and walk over to the parade and beat the crowds

data.title: The Lights Are Gaudy, But It Is A Christmas Tradition
data.text: Well worth a visit every year. You can take a carriage ride by this site, so think about doing that after a dinner in downtown.

data.title: A City Lightshow, Anyone?
data.text: The only public city hall that I know that shows its spirit during the holiday season with the grandest lightshow known in Denver...and afar. But it doesn't stop during the winter holidays but continues during the 4th of July fireworks when the same lights come alive to a concert band and fireworks...wow!

data.title: Nice Building, but Apparently Haunted
data.text: My mom and I took a downtown tour, and learned about this building.  It's an amazing building.  The architecture was unbelievable, and there was a funny story about the eagle above that is holding it's wings in a manner indicating the fact that it's about to defecate.   Otherwise, there are a lot of stories about ghosts.  This was the first time for us to visit.

data.title: Worthwhile to visit at night during the winter holidays only
data.text: The architecture is nice enough. You might be able to steal inside and check out a courtroom or two. One of the ones upstairs has been preserved (and it, like the others, are part of an active courthouse - so this isn't really a tourist spot, so don't get expect easy entry). The best time to view the building is at night between Thanksgiving and Christmas, when the building it spectacularly lit for the holidays. The actual lighting of the lights is a major city event, with dignitaries and large crowds.

data.title: Nice but don't miss visiting the Capital Building :)
data.text: While at Civic Park, plan to visit the Colorado State Capital Building, the Denver Library, the Art Museum, the Mint Building, and the Colorado History museum. All within walking distance from the 16th Street Mall and the Colorado Convention Center. Awesome

data.title: Enjoyable to walk around
data.text: This building had a lot of lights and many wishes of holiday cheer.  Easy access and even spreads cheer from intersections fairly far away due to the garden.

data.title: Beautiful sight for the Xmas
data.text: It was really beautiful to see city and county building with all the decorated lights. But it will available during the xmas season, i believe so.

data.title: The feel of the holiday season approaching.
data.text: This is my favorite spot to see every December, and take company to. If you attend the Parade of Lights it goes by right in front of this lit up building and is just bursting with holiday cheer. The building is a big curve, so there are many angles you can get that differ if taking pictures. Then we continue downtown to see all the rest of the lights, we always hope it's snowing that day, icing on cake!

data.title: Overwhelming Lights Display
data.text: For about 80 years, the City and County Building has been lit up with Christmas lights. This year, they are absolutely gorgeous. A little gaudy, yes, but if you can't be gaudy at the holidays, when can you be? From the City/County Building, down 16th St Mall to Union Station, there are well over 1M lights this year. Beautiful holiday tradition!

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: We didn't go inside but the exterior is amazing, day or night.  We were surprised to see the impressive lights that evening.  It is breathtaking beautiful.

data.title: Historical
data.text: Great place especially during the Holidays. It's very nice to see festive lights they use to decorate the building.

data.title: A beautiful building, in a very nice setting.
data.text: The City and County Building, and its environs (park, library, capitol) combine to make a very pleasant anchor to Denver.

data.title: Typical beauracracy locale
data.text: Pay your tickets, go to traffic court, in an historic building... I think the mayor and city council offices still reside here despite all the newer city office buildings nearby.
